direction.raw_text: A gaping hole in the concrete side of a freeway. On the embankment beside the hole BRENDAN FRYE squats, shoulders hunched. His dark eyes behind thin glasses watch the shallow stream of water which flows into the tunnel.

direction.raw_text: One of many instances of an allusion to the Jerr backstory, most of which were trimmed back in the editing process for clarity. The author has threatened to write it as a stand alone short story, but probably never will, so in a nutshell: when Brendan and Emily were still an item she started hanging out with Jerr, a small time dealer. Brendan didn't approve, so he partnered up with Jerr then ratted him out to Trueman. Emily found out, and that led to their breakup on the field, which we see in a flashback.

direction.raw_text: . STOCKTON COVE GATE - NIGHT An imposing private community gate. Brendan coasts up on his bike and ditches it in the bushes. He checks the call box directory: "42 -- DANNON" Using the call box as a hand hold he hops the gate and walks briskly up the street.

direction.raw_text: Shiny cars line the curb. Party noises come from an upscale two story house. Brendan takes a short breath, then strides up to the front door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Large and clean, with a two story ceiling and a railed staircase at one end. Fifteen or twenty clean people, some in costumes, mill about in cliques. Brendan comes in as if he doesn't mind who sees him coming in. He gets a couple odd stares, but no one stops him. With non obtrusive confidence he cuts through the crowd to the beer keg in back and draws half a cup.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richly adorned, crowded, lit with bright pools of light. Brendan drifts in and stands in the back, deep in shadow. The music comes from a baby grand piano set against one wall. Laura Dannon leans against it. She wears a red kimono, and is striking against the velvet black piano. Laura's kid sister, 11 years old with glasses, sits at the piano playing "All I do is Dream of You". Laura sings, lovely and soft but with strength.1 Brendan watches from the back, his face obscured in shadow, but his eyes gleam. Through the darkened window behind him a match flares up, and someone standing outside lights a cigarette. Laura finishes the song. The room applauds, and she ruffles her kid sister's hair. Brendan ducks out, and into
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By the time we got around to production this had changed to "Someone to Watch Over Me," but the publishing rights proved too expensive (i.e. not free.) We chose the Gilbert & Sullivan song, which besides being lovely was also in the public domain (i.e. free.)

direction.raw_text: . LIVING ROOM - SAME Brad Bramish, the jock who was kissing Laura in the parking lot, sits slouched on the couch in a dense crowd. He holds a cup and speaks much too loudly to a guy named Biff at his elbow.

direction.raw_text: Brad hunches forward, his face swollen purple, yelling that over and over. Tom steps in front of Brendan, blocking his line of sight. Brendan scans the rest of the room. His eyes catch on Laura, leaning against a divan. Her bright, sharp eyes cut through the room, straight into Brendan. He wags his eyebrows at her. She looks away quickly. Brendan turns back to Brad, still shouting 'let me play'. Tom stands between them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brad falls silent. Most of the room follows suit. Tom turns around. Brendan smiles good naturedly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The room watches Brendan. Tom mumbles something and steps aside. Brad stares at Brendan stupidly. Brendan flashes a dopey grin and tips his glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He falls into awkward silence. Biff starts babbling. Brendan looks at Brad, who is staring back at him. Brendan then slowly drags his gaze over to Laura, staring at him too, her eyes slightly amused. Brendan cocks an eyebrow. The slightest hint of a smile takes the corner of her mouth, and she wags her eyebrows once at him. Brendan glances back at Brad, looking at Laura now, not amused at all. Brendan stands to go. Biff chatters on. Brad cuts him off.
direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A brightly lit window in the side of Brad's house, and through the window the party. A dark figure wearing a long coat and broad rimmed hat, all inky black. The figure smokes a cigarette and watches the party, absently stroking his cheek. Brendan steps back - SNAP!   A twig. The figure freezes. Then, making no noise at all, it spins to face Brendan, a towering black form against the window. The glowing cigarette falls to the grass. A metallic glint, and a clicking sound not unlike a gun. Brendan throws himself backwards onto the grass. A beat. Through the hole the black of the figure's cloak whips away. Brendan hesitates, then hops the fence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brendan lands on his feet. No black figure to be found. The cigarette still smolders on the ground. Hand rolled, plain paper. Brendan gazes through the window, catching his breath. Then he breaks the trance and creeps towards the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Peeking around the house, Brendan sees Laura cut across the lawn and trot into the street. Using parked cars as cover, Brendan follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Between cars, Brendan sees a lanky kid in baggy jeans and engineer boots with a clean shaven head leaning against a black Mustang. Laura goes to him and speaks quickly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The dark figure in the hat emerges from the shadows. Laura says something to him. Grunting something angrily, he gets in the car with the bald kid and peels off. Laura turns and slowly walks towards the house. When she is gone Brendan stands, throws a look back at the house and walks off down the street, towards the guard gate.

direction.raw_text: The two drinks, where Brendan left them. Laura takes hers and drains it. The suburban lights twinkle like stars.

direction.raw_text: The sun rises over Carrows family restaurant, a squat structure backed against the weedy edge of the runoff tunnel ravine. A banner from 1973 in the window - "Coffee and Pie oh my!" A pack of six pale stoners slump against the rear dumpster. Their beady eyes follow Brendan in sync as he approaches. He goes to the nearest one.

direction.raw_text: Silence and blank stares. Brendan calmly moves to the next stoner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brendan moves to the next one. A thin head pokes from around the dumpster.
direction.name: direction

Brendan slams Dode's frail frame against the dumpster. The 5 stoners stand in the exact same position, deer in the headlights. One makes a half hearted motion to intervene.

direction.raw_text: Back off.

direction.raw_text: Brendan covers how shaken he is by this statement fairly well. He drops Dode.

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Today. She knows where I eat lunch.

direction.raw_text: Brendan hides behind a tall clump of bushes. A moment later Dode hustles away from Carrows. Brendan follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sun is rising as Brendan tails Dode through the twisty suburban streets. Brendan takes cover as Dode stops by a white hatchback. A girl gets out of the car and embraces Dode. Her wrist is adorned with the same cheap plastic bracelets as the dead girl's arm. Dode speaks quickly to her, she nods and speaks back. He hands her a slip of paper, which she tucks into a brightly colored address book and slips in her jacket pocket. They embrace again, Dode walks off and the girl gets in her car. Brendan stumbles after the car, but it is quickly gone. He watches it go, then follows Dode back towards school.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dode slumps into the front door of the brown building. Brendan watches him from a distance, eyes thoughtful. After a beat he turns and walks off into the thickening crowds of students.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BACK OF SCHOOL - MIDDAY Brendan eats lunch alone on a concrete wall beside a long, empty utility road behind the school.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Reclining on the wall, reading "Lord of the Flies". He raises his eyes, and sits up suddenly. 23 Off in the distance on the utility road a tiny figure approaches, stumbling. Brendan jumps and hits the ground running towards the figure. Meet the girl with cheap bracelets, the girl Dode spoke to, the dead girl, Emily. He catches her just as she stumbles and falls and carries her into the shade of a covered hallway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Emily and Brendan sit in silence. She is very pretty, but she looks bad. Too much makeup, not enough sleep. She sniffles, speaks to her shoes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She taps her shoes together lightly, eyes fixed on them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She turns her weak eyes to Brendan for the first time.     His stare is unwavering, searching. She pushes on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She looks back at her shoes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's a good friend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A beat. She taps her clogs. One has a hole worn through the sole. Her face contorts, seizes up, and she is sobbing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Growing larger, burning with a searing intensity, then folding into darkness. Water rushes overhead, over concrete, concrete with a hole in it -- the runoff tunnel, just for an instant, then back underwater, screaming. Brendan choking, screaming, plunging upwards. A woman with no face falls from the darkness and kisses him, her long hair sweeping around him then pulling away. As the last strands slide off his face he wakes up with a start. The clock says 3:46. Brendan drips with sweat, breathing raggedly. He takes the paper and a pencil from the nightstand and shades the symbol to look like this:

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Laura pulls up in her convertible, behind Brad, watching. In the next moment Brendan cuts Brad off by putting his fist in his face. Brad grunts but doesn't lose ground. Brendan throws his short stocky frame into Brad's larger one and tenderizes his midsection with jabs. Brad tags Brendan in the ribs, then smacks the palm of his hand into Brendan's face, shoving him back onto the pavement. He comes at Brendan with his big fists clenched. Brendan kicks Brad full force in the shins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brad tumbles, and Brendan comes up fast, connecting hard with the point of Brad's chin. Brad gets his balance fast, and before Brendan can throw another he throws one himself, then another, both into Brendan's stomach. Brendan pulls back and kicks Brad's shin where he had kicked it before. Brad roars and hits Brendan very hard in the face. Brendan bounces back like a rubber ball and throws his weight into a square punch right into Brad's nose. The sound of eggs breaking, and Brad falls backwards like a board. He stays down, holding his face. Brendan staggers back, breathing hard, and looks up at the small crowd. Some stare at Brendan, some at Brad, but nobody seems about to do anything. Brendan runs his sleeve over his face and walks unsteadily off, pushing past the last few people rushing over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He throws a last look at Laura, who meets his gaze and drives off.

dialogue.raw_text: (anger builds) You know what I'm in if the wrong yeg saw me pulled in here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. And no more of these informal chats - if you've got a discipline issue with me write me up or suspend me and I'll see you at the parent conference.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hold it, I could - hold it - could write you up for talking back to a VP. For looking at me in a threatening way. I'd exercise a little more tact, Mr. Frye. You can't pull a play like that unless I need you for something. So do I?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So maybe you're gonna need me too.

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe. Alright, I need you off my back completely for a few weeks. There might be some heat soon.

dialogue.raw_text: If I get caught like that it's curtains anyway - I couldn't have brass cutting me favors in public. I'm just saying now so you don't come kicking in my homeroom door once trouble starts.

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, here's what I can do. I won't pin you for anything you aren't caught at. I'll ride it a little while, as long as it doesn't get too rough. But if anything comes up with your fingerprints on it, I can't help you. Also, if I get to the end of whatever this is and it gets hot and you don't deliver, The Veep will need someone to hand over, police- wise. And I'll have you. There better be some meat at the end of this like you say, or at least a fall guy, or you're it.

dialogue.raw_text: Sure I am. Got one more favor to ask.

direction.raw_text: Bordering a supermarket. Brendan trudges along. Suddenly he stops. Parked in the supermarket parking lot is a black mustang.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sun hangs low. Brendan approaches the car and walks around it slowly. He peers inside. A tuft of paper pokes out from under the seat. He pulls the door handle, locked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brendan picks up a broken chunk of concrete from the ground, waddles over to the car and holds the chunk above his head, ready to drop it through the window. He stops. His eyes catch something in the distance. The lanky shaved-head kid, whose name is Tugger.   Coming towards him fast. Brendan stands there for a moment, then lets the chunk fall to the ground. He casually leans against the car, removes his glasses, puts them in a hard case and puts the hard case in his pocket. Tugger hits him like a train and throws him across the pavement. Tug turns back to the car and takes out his keys. Brendan gets up and comes towards Tug, his face stiff. Tug turns and pops him once squarely in the mouth. Brendan falls to his knees. While Tug unlocks the door Brendan stands up woozily. Grunting, Tug spins and grabs Brendan's jacket, pushing him back while he slaps him hard in the face, back and forth, three times. When Tug lets go Brendan drops like a stone, catching himself on his hands and knees. The car door slams. The mustang drives about a hundred yards out into the parking lot, spins around and stops, facing Brendan. Its motor purrs deeply. Brendan begins to limp towards it doggedly, head up, eyes fixed. A crackling roar and short squeal of tires spit the mustang forward. It comes straight at Brendan, rumbling like a tank. Brendan stops walking and stands very still, eyes steady. The gap between him and the car closes in no time at all. It speeds past him not six inches to his left, brushing the edge of his jacket. Brakes squeal behind him. Brendan turns and lopes towards the mustang, idling about fifty feet away. He stops at the window.   Tugger eyes him curiously, with some respect.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . STREETS Twisty and narrow. The black mustang flies through them at impossible speeds, roaring past like a bullet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Through the ajar trunk. The mustang slides to a stop beside an elaborate wooden mailbox carved as an eagle's head. Brendan closes the trunk.

direction.raw_text: A small one story house, slightly run down. Tugger opens the trunk and drags Brendan out, covering his eyes with a palm, slams the trunk and goes inside. When they are gone the broken trunk drifts open.

direction.raw_text: A very dim narrow hall with a steep stairway at one end, dark doors down the length of it and a lit door at the other end. Tugger drags Brendan down the stairway, drops him and goes into the lit room.

direction.raw_text: Unfortunately Mr. Taylor flatly refused, which, given the context, was probably wise.

direction.raw_text: Brendan lifts his head painfully. Surrounding him in the darkened doorways are dozens of boys, some dressed like Tugger, others dressed in black. Tug pokes his head out.

direction.raw_text: Arms pop out of the darkness and drag Brendan towards the lit room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A small room, amazingly messy. Clothes strewn about, groves of empty bottles, precarious piles of books. The overall impression though is not of jumbled chaos, but of a nest, comfortably woven and very worn in. A slim figure with wispy hair sits facing the wall at a small desk, writing under a green bookkeeper's lamp. Brendan is shoved into the center of the room. Tug and his clones slump against the surrounding walls. Brendan watches the thin figure's back. For a beat the only noise is the scratching of the thin man's pencil. Then he sighs and swivels around. Mid to late twenties. Sallow features, tired eyes. His clothes are so richly black it is difficult to make out specific items -- he is just one inky black mass from the neck down and eyebrows up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Pin shifts in his seat, bored.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: with a nick on its ear he can suck on. They do that. (Brendan blinks) So now you got Tugger to bring you here, which he never does, and you got me listening, so I'm curious what you've got to say that better be really, really good.

direction.raw_text: The Pin's eyes shoot to Tugger, who doesn't flinch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The world turns on its side as Tugger pushes Brendan's head down into the carpet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Pin walks towards them. One of his shoes is twice the size of the other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cronies around the room begin cackling. Tug's face is a mask of rage. Brendan can't breath. His face swells.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Alright, let up. But Tug doesn't let up. Brendan's world grows hazy, the cackling laughter reverberates, then a clean voice pierces the din.

direction.raw_text: Tug's face breaks for a moment, and he lets go. Brendan's head lolls to the side. Laura stands in the dark doorway. Brendan sees Tug's knuckles and a flash of white for a split moment as Tug hits him in the face. The Pin's black body spills out across the frame, leaving us in black.

direction.raw_text: Brendan wakes up curled on a mattress on the floor. A bare light bulb hangs from the ceiling. Tugger sits five feet away, watching him like a hungry dog. Brendan stares back at him through thick, glazed eyes.

direction.raw_text: Tug points, amused. Brendan heaves himself up, and Tug shoves him back down. Brendan winks at him, stands and lurches towards the door again. Tugger grabs his shirt and slams him into the wall, but freezes when he hears a door latch click. Sneering, he drops Brendan back onto the mattress and sits against the opposite wall. Sounds of a door opening and closing come from the darkness. Light footsteps clack on the cement floor. Suddenly Tug vanishes -- the room's darkness just seems to swallow him. The thin whispery voice of the Pin speaks softly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His disembodied face appears a few feet about where Tug had sat.

direction.raw_text: He is standing in front of Tug. His black clothes and broad rimmed black hat blend perfectly with the dark room, such that his face seems to bob about in space. Brendan stifles a cough.

dialogue.raw_text: Where are my glasses? (Tugger grins) Hell with ya then. Which wall's the door in?

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Where you were at, with all of us and the Tug a fist away, you've got to use your nut. Allay the situation, So yeah, you're not scared of me, I got it, but I'm also thinking you're a little nuts now, so you've got that trade off with your standing. But nuts isn't all bad, so maybe it was a good play. I don't know.

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) So, Laura talked me down. Let's get you upstairs, back with the living.

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah well. I didn't ask him to, but he was a straight player. I got out clean - almost. Nothing on my official record, but the VPs play it like I owe them one. When I made it clear I wasn't playing their hound dog, well they didn't like it. They keep calling me in, badgering me.

dialogue.raw_text: Fair enough. I'll have my boys check your tale, and seeing how it stretches we'll either rub or hire you. You'll know which by end of the day tomorrow.

He wears a black trenchcoat over bulbous shoulders, and his black hair comes down over his eyes like a sheepdog's.

direction.raw_text: Closer, not slowing. Brendan tightens his hand into a fist. Then CLICK! and a long slender switchblade gleams in the lug's right paw. Brendan jumps back as the lug swipes the blade at his torso. Before the lug winds up for another slash Brendan is running.

direction.raw_text: Brendan runs through the empty campus square, the lug follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wind rushing, sweating, the lug very close. Their footsteps clatter on the cement. Brendan swings around a corner, doubles back and stops with his back to a wall - he's lost sight of him. Brendan sweats, listening. The lug's footsteps echo through the hallways, coming from all directions at once. Then it seems clear - he's down the hall on Brendan's right. Brendan dashes left. Wrong. The lug looms over him, his knife hand flashing. Brendan's jacket shoulder tears open, and the white filling inside turns red. He stumbles back blindly, gets his footing and scrambles out of reach. Brendan sprints away, down the hall, gaining about thirty feet on the lug before turning the corner. Brendan drops to a sitting position.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Running fast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kicks his shoes off and clambers to his feet. The lug's footsteps are impossibly loud.

direction.raw_text: Just about to round the corner.

direction.raw_text: On his socked feet running silently back towards the corner. The lug's footsteps crash like symbols as they both come around the same corner in opposite directions at full speed. Brendan slides like a baseball player, tangling his legs into the lug's. The lug pitches forward with frightening momentum. He hits the hall's metal handrail with his arms and head. A hollow gong reverberates through the hallway, and the lug falls like a puppet with his strings cut. A wallet with a couple of twenties and a student ID (CHUCK BURNS), three hash pipes, fifteen joints, a baggie of weed and a large brownie in another baggie. Brendan leaves it all on him and staggers off.

direction.raw_text: They sit in the sand, facing the breakers.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, I'm fine. Keep digging on the Burns lug, but the main thing is to find Dode. He set up whatever Emily walked into, it's getting more and more urgent we talk.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Alright. Trueman was looking for you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's not good. Alright, keep me posted.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So I'm going to start you on the dope circles, cleaning up the Turkish dues, pulling in the strags.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, well. Just to see how you handle. Anyway there isn't much else doing. I'm tailing out this big deal, but that's almost done.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Big time. Biggest I ever done, and there was a snag in it, but it's almost done now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's over enough. You're gonna make me curious, being so curious.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) I gotta lay something out. You're coming into a certain situation, and I'm bringing you in sort of because of it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: If ever you want to witness a look of pure horror, shoot a micro budget feature film and tell your cinematographer that there will be an extended scene on a beach at night. Turns out it's difficult to light up a beach without very large and expensive equipment. Who knew. Shooting at sunset proved a fortunate and less horror inducing solution.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (beat) I didn't tell Tugger to hit you for the Brad Bramish thing. Laura and I, I decided I oughta hear what you were gunning for before I made an enemy. Tug just did it, though. He was hot, and he just hit you. He's been doing that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A moment of silence. The breakers crash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He makes you want to be there. The waves crash. Behind them, with no warning at all, a train shoots by. Tug stands with his hands jammed in his pockets, flashing lights and gleaming metal streaking and squealing behind him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: He's got my best interests, I know, he's loyal, he just gets hot.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Muscle you can't control's no good at that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're working for me, not Tug, that's all.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Things can get, you know, it's tough sometimes. Twisted, complicated, watching all the, I don't know. Everyone's got their thing. (silence) You read Tolkien?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: His descriptions of things are really good.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The clock radio blinks 5:34. The phone is ringing. Brendan half wakes and puts it to his ear.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (on the phone) Don't go to class.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fifth period Trueman and the VP come in asking for you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get out of there too, then. Meet me behind the library. I've got some stuff.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A cold gray morning. The Brain hands Brendan a photocopy of a newspaper clipping, "LOCAL YOUTH HOSPITALIZED" THE BRAIN Frisco Farr was found on a sidewalk outside Pinkerton's Deli three weeks ago. He was in a coma, his stomach contained a sausage sandwich, a horse dose of Heroin and traces of Choleric Tricemate, a poisonous chemical found in laundry detergent. Frisco's still under
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and nobody's talking, so nothing's come of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He gives the note to Brendan, who unfolds it roughly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The note reads "Meet me at the southeast corner of the school at 9:30." Brendan crumples it into a ball.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Brain lays out a local newspaper with Emily's picture -
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: No, the chem the junk must have been cut with put him down.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Huh. Bad junk. Bad brick... could that form of Heroin be called 'Brick'?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No -- it was a concentrated powder, its street handle's 'whip' or 'rock' or 'brock'. (fishes a note from his pocket) Here. From Laura.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I told you to stay clear of Laura.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You tell her to stay clear of me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) No. Tell her I'll be at the Pin's at one. Any luck with the lug?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . Uncomfortable silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Brain looks hard at him. Brendan stares off into space for a beat, then takes the Brain's cell phone and dials.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) (into phone) Mr. Trueman please. Brendan compares the two notes from his pocket with Laura's - distinct handwriting on each.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brendan hangs up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: anything drop, so I gotta push things a bit.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What the hell are you doing asking for me in class?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What the hell are you doing out of class?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (very deliberate) The VP and I needed to ask you a few questions about Emily Kostich, who you might have heard is missing. It's a very serious thing. The police are involved. The VP and I knew you two were close, so the VP and I came to ask you questions, but you were truant. If you don't have a valid excuse-
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've been cut loose. I'm not safe here. We shouldn't have met in the open. Alright, lay low, but ask on the underneath for Dode. That's all that matters now, find Dode, but do it on the underneath, got it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you going to do?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'd like to have played it safe, but there's no time. The Pin's not letting
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know. Just find Dode.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The bird of prey mailbox looms ominously. Brendan knocks on the front door. No answer. He presses lightly on the screen door, and it gives.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Empty. Brendan crosses the warped linoleum and gently opens the narrow basement door. He descends into inky gloom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deathly still and silent. Barely breathing, Brendan goes to the lit doorway at the end of the hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Empty. Brendan floats through the room like a ghost, to the Pin's desk. Slowly, then with greater confidence he rifles through it - papers and trinkets, meaningless. He reaches beneath the desk, knocking it gently with his knuckles. Quickly he removes the top drawer and reaches down into the desk frame. Brendan draws out a stack of hundred dollar bills two inches thick. He pulls out another. Another. Another. Thumbing the stacks -- pure hundreds. Something creaks in the hallway. Brendan freezes. Silently he replaces the money and drawer, his eyes on the doorway. He creeps towards the door on the balls of his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still empty. Brendan creeps towards the stairs, passing other doorways, all open but for one. He stops for a moment, listening - silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . STORAGE ROOM - SAME Brendan enters the room - pitch black but for a small high window. Brendan pulls the curtains aside. A beam of sunlight spills just enough light to reveal a figure in the dark. Brendan jumps back, and his reflection in the large mirror jumps as well. A white bird nesting in the window flutters into the dark room. Brendan walks the large mirror into the beam of light, reflecting it around the room like a flashlight. More junk, a mattress, then a strangely bare corner with a single white lump in it. The white bird stands behind the lump, its dark eyes caught in the bare light. The bird flies out the window. Brendan goes to the white lump, a small brick of white powder. White chalky residue patterns the floor -- there were other bricks there before. Behind Brendan, in the mirror, something moves. Someone else, in the room. Tugger. He throws Brendan across the room, then heaves him into a wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tug loosens his grip. Brendan gasps for air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tug draws back a bit.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What with the poking, genius?! Maybe you're poking for your bull friends!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't be a sap. I can't even face up at school, the VP's so hot for me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah well. Maybe you're looking to make good.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm looking to find this big game the Pin's played, not to gum it, but just so when its tail jams in my back I'll know who to bill for the embalming.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You oughta ask him what you wanna know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I did. He didn't tell me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) When a gee I'm paid to side with won't give me the straight that makes me nervous. Makes me angry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Tug sets a country glass of orange juice in front of Brendan. He paces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He stops, thinking harder than he's used to. His scar reddens slightly, then he jerks out of his trance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A quiet pause. Tug's scar reddens a bit more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The screen door swings open -- enter the Pin. If he's surprised he doesn't show it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pow wowing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His big foot clunks on the linoleum. He eyes a very sick looking Brendan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brendan moves a hand dismissively, sniffling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What has Emily got to do with you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He gives a slip of paper to Tugger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tugger glances at the slip, then slides it to Brendan. It has the symbol drawn in pencil: A horn honks outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Pin calls after him as he leaves.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: There was ten of them. I don't know where he picked them, he didn't tell me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So we get ten kils of brock, there aint enough marks in the whole burgh to eat that. So he unloads eight of em up way north, even up to the docks. I don't know who.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. That was eight. So that's the tenth in there. We gotta break it into doses, sell em off round the high, maybe some by Shorecliffs.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ah yeah. There were problems with that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) (quickly) It disappeared. Someone skimmed it. We started raising hell with all the likely suspects, and whatayaknow, it came back. But it came back bad. One of ours took a dose off the top, and it laid him out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, poor Frisco. You heard about that. We'll track down the rat. Just takes time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I heard something fell with Emily Kostich.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Has the Pin talked about her?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, he might know something. Ask him. Tell me what he says, cause if you heard something, you know, I wanna check.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) So, Tug, I got a call. Someone who says they know something about Emily.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Emily Kostich. Where she's at now. Says we'd want to know. Wants to meet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So we'll meet him. Four o'clock. (to Brendan) Emily was Tug's girl for awhile. You know Emily, didn't you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So maybe you want to come along too.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (looks at Tugger) Show, maybe we'll find out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Brendan falls into Laura's idling car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brendan throws the car into drive, and they jerk forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The mobile customer you have called is away from the phone- Brendan slams the phone down violently and walks back towards the car. His legs quiver, and a coughing fit hits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hacking and spluttering he falls to his knees. Laura's arms wrap around him, except it isn't Laura, it's Emily. Brendan spins backwards into
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Emily kissing his mouth, her hair around him, but it isn't her hair, it's Laura's. Brendan shoots upwards
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and sits up with a jolt. Laid out in the back seat, Laura dabbing his head with a wet napkin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He throws himself out of the car.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You've got a fever, you've got to go to the hospital or-
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Three forty. You've got to rest, you're feverish.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Brendan falls to his knees, coughing. Laura follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He keeps yelling that until she does. His head spins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He holds her shoulders. A beat, then her face registers resignation.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Get back in the car, I'm taking you home, you're sick, you need-
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shut up! Shut up! Shut up!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Okay, you've got to, what you've got to do is drive around to the Carrows lot. 79 I'll be up on the, the blacktop, the basketball field. So you've got to go by you or me to get down there. If you see anyone but the Pin or Tugger or their crew go down into the ravine, honk four times, long short long short. But don't be seen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do it! Will you do it? I need you to do this. I need you, here. Please.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A flat plane of pebbly asphalt with a dozen basketball courts faintly outlined across its surface. Brendan stands crooked, watching the barren horizon. The wind blows bitterly, and the sky is dark. Then, a speck. Coming towards Brendan, across the field. Brendan slumps towards it. Closer. Still a dark dot. Closer. Brendan's face snaps into recognition.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dode grins. He holds a newspaper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were with her, dead, and you took the body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brendan staggers, the world blurs out for a moment, then snaps back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -so I'm telling you now you're in over your head, you don't want to put your hand in this- Dode shakes the newspaper at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dode throws the paper, which scatters in the wind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brendan's face is empty. Dode walks stiffly away. Brendan puts a hand on his shoulder, but shrinks back in a coughing spasm. Dode grabs Brendan's wrist and hits him in the face. Brendan hits the pavement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HEAVEN - DAY Bright clouds, sharp light. Emily flies towards us, glowing, then dimmer, her wings splutter out, the clouds turn gray, and we are looking at Emily's picture in the newspaper article.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What do you think you're doing, Dode?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I saw you. I saw what you did.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, I did. That's all you saw? What about before?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did you see who killed her before I got there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You, I thought you didn't, but we figured out, I got the news on ya, cause you hid the body, why wouldn't-
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shut up! You're always talking, always this and that smartso, you're gonna shut up now!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're not going to talk this!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Dode, I know you're thinking of Em, I know you tried to help her-
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shut up! You're gonna shut your
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why was she scared, Dode? She came to me, who was she scared of? I think I know why, I just gotta know who!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You couldn't stand it. Your little Em. She was gonna keep it, it was mine, and you couldn't stand that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I loved her. And I woulda loved the kid. I'm gonna bury you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Brendan pulls the newspaper off his face, lying in a fetal position. Dode is nowhere to be seen. Slowly, painfully, Brendan hoists himself up. He coughs and splutters, barely able to keep his footing. He limps across the field. Every step is agony. The wind blows against him. The black field seems impossibly long, still he keeps limping forward, towards the ravine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brendan slides down the embankment, landing on his feet. Gathered around the drain tunnel entrance are Tugger, the Pin, five of Tugger's flunkies and Dode in the middle. Everyone looks at Brendan. A long silence. Brendan clears his throat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: More silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody reacts to that. Brendan's face is placid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So walk. What's the info have to do with you anyways?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Pin looks up at Brendan, whose face is loose and nonchalant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tugger's eyes are locked on Dode, his scar the color of raw liver. Brendan laughs and turns away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tugger twists a stick in his hands. Brendan watches him, curious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tugger springs like a cat.     He grabs Dode's hair and knees his face. Brendan stumbles towards them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tug has Dode on the ground, kicking his stomach and chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tug backs off. Dode raises his head. Tug pulls the gun from his jacket. Brendan yells, slips and falls into the shallow water. Tug levels the gun at Dode's head and fires one shot. The back of Dode's skull comes off. The rapport reverberates through the black tunnel behind them, and birds fly out. Dode remains upright for a moment, then falls limp into the water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Pin's face is stupid, lifeless. Tug turns to him, gun in hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tugger fires - dirt kicks up, and the Pin scrambles back. Brendan crawls towards Tug, yelling for him to stop. Tug fires twice more, both misses, and the Pin is away. Distant sirens. Brendan's vision blurs.   He stumbles and falls into the shallow water.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Dode here says Emily Kostich is dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. He says he knows who did it. He says he knows where the body's at. (beat of silence) And he says he wants more money than I think the information's worth.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Uh huh. And he wants cash on the nail. He's a pot skulled reef worm with more hop in his head than blood. Why pay for dirt you can't believe?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You'll believe it, cause it's someone close to you. Real close.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe it's hot, but it's Dode, you can't trust it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm getting my shoes wet for this. Let him milk you if you want.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Brendan) Stay. (to Dode) It's still too much.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No it's not. You won't complain when you hear it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You had her against the wall with the brick -
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know my business. It's still too much.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (with growing confidence) It's not, cause that's not why she was killed, and it's real important to you, cause the person who killed her's real close, and cause he's got a lot to lose, and he knows if I don't bury him by spilling to you I spill to the bulls and bury him for real, and he's really really scared - she had a kid in her and he couldn't stand -
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Spinning gently. Brendan's eyes open, watch it sleepily, then sharpen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brendan sits up in the bed. Tugger sits in a chair bedside, smoking. Brendan watches him for a long moment in the room's dim light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brendan stares at him through cold, empty eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone's just laying low. You're here with us, at my folks place. They're gone. The bulls got Dode fore the tide took his body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brendan nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brendan swings his legs over the bed. Tug steps in front of him, staring him down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tugger exits. Brendan runs his fingers through his hair, steps into his shoes and hobbles out of the room.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: She sprung it on me, just. That's a hell of a thing to spring on a guy. I don't remember much. Laura talked me down after, said whatever, she knew her, said it wasn't true, but I still think sometimes. I think bout it being true. Bout it being mine. And maybe I did it cause I thought it was true. A hell of a thing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) You up? You weren't doing too good there for awhile. Laura said take you, you know, hospital, but I couldn't.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, strong tide, would've taken the body, like out to sea. It can do that. But the fuzz got there first.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) So everyone's assuming it's war, but no one's said it yet. Everyone's lying low.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So just lie low. Sleep some more. Laura, she said you should sleep.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: About ten more kids dressed like Tug are cleaning guns. Brendan nods to them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They nod back, not paying much attention as he goes out the front door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On a lamplit street corner Brendan leans against a payphone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, I'm going to be calling you tonight, probably late. Sleep with your phone on. Could you get a car if you needed to?
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Are you - what, man, have you heard about Dode-
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where were you yesterday? I called.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Kasprzyk took my phone, turned it off. I just now got it back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just listen. Is my name in the papers with the story?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Alright. Is it just Dode in the papers?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If it's late enough I could take my mom's-
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Brendan kicks in the door. Kara sits in front of the mirror in a soft pink robe, a boy on the floor beside her. She gasps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brendan throws a chair. The boy stands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He goes, trying to look mean at Brendan. Brendan and Kara watch each other like caged rats.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brendan grabs a clock and throws it. Kara's mirror shatters, revealing a grimy dark wall behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She comes very close to him. Her robe falls open slightly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She turns away, lets her robe fall.1
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brendan's eyes burn. He lunges at her.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Brendan. Did you hear about Dode?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You scheming tramp. You set that poor kid up, you hid him, fed him your tale. You got info from Laura and held Dode like a card till you could play him. For money!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know what you're talking about.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You'd bury me at the same time, but it was mostly for the money. You got Dode thinking Em had his kid, thinking I did it, and that was enough for him, but he stuck to the money cause you had your claws in him, cause he couldn't come away from the deal without it and make you happy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sit down, you're a mess. Russ, go get my shoes from the wardrobe locker, would you sweetie?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Still wish you knew what you wanted to know? If it's any consolation, it probably wasn't Dode's kid. It might have been Tug's, but frankly I wouldn't bet a horse - it was a crowded field there at the end.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Meany. You want my tale, Brendan? I still know what Dode was selling, but I'd play it smart. A quick call from a payphone to copland, they drag the tunnel and you're through.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Five thousand. Cash. I know you can get it from the Pin, but even if you can't I want it by first period tomorrow, or I play my hand and bury you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Drama geeks sit in groups. The dressing room door flies open and Kara flies out, stark naked. Brendan flies out after her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brendan storms out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Also on the DVD. Fine retailers everywhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PIN'S HOUSE - NIGHT Brendan walks past the bird of prey mailbox. A voice from the screen door -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Pin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beat of silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright. So he's a hot head. So you don't want him on your side, at least let's have a pow wow fore we start digging trenches. Maybe we can all walk away amiable enemies. What would it take?

direction.raw_text: Brendan turns away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She comes out of the house with her purse.

dialogue.raw_text: The stats are war, soon as the press heat dies. And if you're with him, you're with him.

dialogue.raw_text: Tug's been after my digs from the get go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. He's been anxious cause he thought if you found out he killed Emily you'd turn him over.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I told him to get the straight, no roughing. I wasn't even there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know. We'd have to square everything between us. He owes me some money.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tonight. Let's clear it all before it boils up again.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Laura drives, Brendan stares at the passing lights.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brendan coughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Do you feel better?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brendan stumbles in. Tug's hands grab him roughly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Laura enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He drops Brendan. Laura kneels beside Brendan, feeling his forehead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (between coughs) Besides, he's got you on the Dode thing. War'll mean you vs. him and every bull in the burgh. Tugger turns away, thinking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She nods. Brendan stumbles into the bedroom.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: For a smart guy you aint too smart. I said lay low.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Uh huh. So here's the sit. You and the Pin are going to pow wow, four o'clock tonight, his place. Take all the muscle you want, you won't need it. He wants to talk straight, and you're going to work with him for whatever he needs, cause you don't want war.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The Pin's sitting on the brick profits - hitting him now would be post. Make peace and wait for your chance.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's right, Tug. Smooth it out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Brendan lies on his back. Sweat stands on his forehead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Spinning dizzily from Brendan's POV. Then the fan is still and the room is spinning, then the fan, then the room. Brendan clamps his eyes shut. A door creaks open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Laura floats across the room to him. Her hair falls around him. Brendan shrinks back. She puts a pale hand on his clammy forehead. Brendan tries to speak, but cannot. He fingers slide over his face. She pulls off his glasses. Her hands all over his face. Brendan's throat contorts in a hard swallow. His eyes are wet. Her hair, her hands all warm and gentle, touching him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brendan breaks. In silent sobs first, then shivering with an almighty release he cries like a baby in her arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Spinning above them. Laura lights a cigarette. They lie beside each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her smoke drifts into the fan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brendan watches the smoke. She stubs the butt out in an ash tray on the table and curls against his chest. Stretching his arm across the table, he nonchalantly spins the ash tray around with his finger. His glasses lay on the table. Through the left lens the cigarette is magnified. Pale blue arrow on the filter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Laura's arm stretches across his chest. He looks at it, then up at the fan, spinning.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I've got to make sure it plays out smooth.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It'll play however it plays without you there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cause if there's war, I'm in it too.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well let's just, I mean why not just run away. Go somewhere. I've got a car. (Brendan gives a wry look) I've got an aunt in New Orleans, she wouldn't care. (Brendan grins) Yeah, it's a stupid thing, but think about it, why not? What, school? C'mon. Family?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I wasn't serious, but we could go for awhile. Just until everything clears.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Brendan slips out of bed. A glowing clock radio reads
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A swarm of silent activity. Tug's flunkies prepare various weapons. Brendan goes to Tug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He tosses Brendan his keys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't smoke cigarettes.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Tell your boys no knuckle business.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your folks left a car here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Take it and Laura's. (Brendan tosses Tug the keys) I'll go first in yours.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll take the scenic route to draw off any tailers. They'll think it's you, they might even radio back that you're alone. Get it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Give me fifteen minutes, then go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Brendan slides into the black mustang and gutters off into the night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Overlooking a twinkling valley of suburban lights. Brendan talks at a payphone beside the curbed mustang.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Alright, I warned you. Can you get the car?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Go to 2014 Clancy, off Pico west of La Grange. Park outside and wait. Laura's inside. She hasn't got a car, but if she blows on foot or gets a pick, tail her. Alright? (silence) Alright?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll call you when it gets light. (silence) Thanks, Brain.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Brain hangs up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brendan pulls the mustang into the driveway, limps up to the front door and knocks. One of the Pin's boys lets him in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KITCHEN - SAME Crowded with tense looking punks, half dressed like the Pin and half like Tugger. The Pin's mom is shuffling about, pouring them milk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Several more punks from both camps crowd the hall, and more lean in the darkened doorways. Brendan passes through quickly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Pin at his desk, flanked by two of his boys. Tug sits in the center of the room, two of his punks beside him. Brendan saunters between them and leans against the dresser.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tug's eyes burn, his scar reddens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tug looks at the Pin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good. Let's seal it up and blow for keeps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brendan looks up sharply, taken off guard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tug shoots to his feet, kicking away his chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wanna see it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone in the room is on their feet.   Brendan steps forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All eyes to him, unbelieving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They go. Tug just stares at Brendan, then tosses his hands up slightly and turns away. They all wait.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I want full assurance that any heat from Emily and Dode is gonna be on just you. I don't even want my name pulled in the shindig. Second, you owe me six Cs, no rush, but I want your shake that it'll come home in not too much time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Tug) That's square. You did them after all. Lay low it'll blow over. Stick on this, one of you'll dish it to bury the other and you'll both get the rap. As to the six, did you borrow it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then you owe it. Shouldn't need a shake on that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That aint the point. I'm gonna start selling it. How do I know it aint bad?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why was the last one? Cause someone got greedy. Tug here's had the means to swipe half and cut it bad for a long time. Now we're splits my loss of trust's retroactive.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Alright, so let's shake and blow.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I wanna see him dose it. Just to prove it. Then we're square.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hell for that! I didn't touch your junk, that's it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your not wanting to dose it's telling me something right here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, it better be! It's telling that I'm out from your thumb, that I aint playing lapdog to no gothed up cripple no more!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If it'll shut you two apes up I'll   take the dose, and if I don't die we're   all right as rain, and if I do die you   two have your war, so long as you keep   it off my grave. Deal?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ! from the next room. Everyone freezes. More breaking, then scuffling and shouting. The two punks look at their bosses, then run out. Tug starts to follow, but Brendan holds him back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The noise through the wall grows tremendous, a full brawl. The ceiling pounds and shudders with footfalls and bodies hitting the ground. Then, from not too far away, a gunshot. The Pin stands and goes towards the door, but Brendan shouts
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and slams it shut. A few tense seconds. Another gunshot. Footfalls, then Tangles falls through the door, his chest red. The Pin bends over him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tangles stops gasping. The Pin stands, eyes blazing at Tug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tug's scar is fiery red. He coils his body, snarling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tug blows past Brendan like a train and slams the Pin into the ground with his fist. He punctuates his words with hard straight blows into the Pin's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) I cut the brick, I stole the money, I faked a peace, I snagged your junk, I did it all! He pulls the gun. Brendan shouts and throws himself on Tug's arm, wrenching it sideways. The gun clunks onto the carpet. The Pin flips Tug   over and for a moment Brendan is caught between them, hit   and torn, rolling over the gun. Tug grabs it, Brendan grabs   his wrist and the gun goes off, firing into the ceiling.   Plaster sprays. Brendan screams, thrashing wildly, and manages to slip out of his bloodied jacket and out from between the two. The Pin is on top, pinning Tug's gun hand to the carpet, straining to keep it there. Brendan leaps to his feet, staggers, then winds up and kicks Tug in the wrist with all his strength. A terrible crunching popping sound. Tug roars. Brendan takes the gun from his limp hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brendan backs off a few steps. The Pin strains to keep Tug down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brendan stumbles back. Tug roars, flips the Pin over and beats his face mercilessly. Brendan stumbles out into the hall.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (gasping) The brick, it's gone. The brick's gone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Make peace, huh? Talk it out? Get your boys in my den soes you could snag it under my nose?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Was it bad, Tug? Snag it so I don't know, or sell it off to flat the war odds?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Empty. From the darkened doorways and the thin ceiling relentless sounds of fighting. Brendan walks backwards as if in a trance, eyes glued to the Pin's door. Inside wild shadows splay across the walls, and the Pin shouts Brendan's name. Light flashes from another darkened doorway and the wall beside Brendan splinters. Brendan spins on his heel and fires three shots into the darkness, which falls silent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns the gun back on the Pin's doorway. With a spray of sparks the doorway turns dark. They broke the lamp. The dark doorway looms up before Brendan, inky black. Horrible sounds come from it, blows, breaking bone, screams. The Pin screams Brendan's name over and over, calling for help. Pleading. Brendan steps back. Time slows down. Brendan drops the gun. It thunks on the carpet. In one motion Brendan kicks the gun down the hall into the Pin's doorway, turns and runs into the room where he found the brick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dark. Brendan runs through, clawing past dark fighting shapes, running like a man possessed. He breaks through the darkness and heaves himself up through the small window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brendan scrambles out, slips on the grass and hits the ground hard. Two sharp gunshots come from the house. Everything is suddenly still. Brendan stands slowly. He notices a light from the Mustang - the trunk has drifted open. Inside, a pale blue arm lies tangled in black plastic. Blue fingernails. Cheap plastic bracelets. Brendan shuts the trunk solidly, then walks off down the street and vanishes into the inky night. A moment later police cars pull up, sirens blaring, lights turning the dark streets bright as day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The morning is cold and clammy. Brendan slumps against the payphone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey. Where are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brendan hangs up, then pauses, lost in thought.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: No. Stayed there till six thirty, then walked to school.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You didn't give her a ride, did you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But she came straight to school from Tug's?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. Not with me, but here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Alright. Tell her I wanna meet up on the basketball field in half an hour, then go home and get some sleep.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Brendan sits against the massive gym building, writing on a piece of looseleaf paper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brendan slips the paper under a door stenciled "VP Offices".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BASKETBALL FIELD - LATER Cold, barren. Wind whistles softly and jangles the metal mesh basketball nets like windchimes. Brendan stands crookedly, hands in pockets, eyes trained on the cold black horizon. A speck appears. Brendan waits for it, bracing himself against the wind. Laura. She puts her arms around him, a warm embrace. Brendan draws back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brendan looks at her a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Laura looks at him strangely, a little uneasy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brendan's face is frozen in an ambiguous frown.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Laura's face softens a bit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Laura embraces him again, and doesn't let go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Laura pulls back, looks at his face. It is a mask.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Laura pulls back more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was you. What, you want the whole tale? You want me to tell it to you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Laura's face is very still, quivering.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brendan, why are you-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She crumples against him, looking him straight in the eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She sobs through a tensed, straight face. Brendan holds her stare, but his eyes are distant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I think you knew that meeting was going to blow up. I think that was your final play. But I hope I'm wrong. I hope everything I wrote in the note I dropped at Gary Trueman's office this morning is wrong. About your and Brad's involvement in the Pin's runnings. I hope you didn't steal the brick last night. In your purse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something changes in Laura's eyes.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (softly) Did you see it all? With Tug and the Pin?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. I took your advice and didn't go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The papers say six dead, three around the house, one girl in the trunk of Tug's car, and the Pin and Tug.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tug tried to shoot his way out when the police got there. They tied him to Dode, too. Same gun. And the girl.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well good thing you weren't there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You think the girl was Emily?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You did all this cause you loved her. And now it's finished. (tightens her embrace) I love you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, it's not finished. Tug pulled the trigger on Em and he got the fall, but the bulls coulda found that out without me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) I set out to know who put her in the spot, who put her in front of the gun. That was you, angel.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (drifting back further) What are you talking about?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Alright, from the top. You had your fingers in Brad Bramish for appearances and to keep him buying from the Pin, who you were hooked with. Emily came to you and Brad, you saw her for what she was, an insecure little girl trying to get in. She goes on the backburner. Meanwhile maybe you're getting bored, maybe just greedy, so when the Pin scores big with the bricks you take your shot. You hook one, take half, and cut it back to size, but you cut it bad. Maybe accidentally, maybe to down the Pin's operation, doesn't matter. You put it back, but poor Frisco doses off it and lands in a coma. (voice strengthening) So now the Pin's fuming, maybe he's jealous of Brad, so he comes to Brad's crowd looking for blood, or at least a scape. You know trouble. There's going to be a war over this. And there's Emily. She trusts you. She wants in. It's duck soup.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You frame her for the bad brick, then you cut her loose. You turn on your heel and bite her in the throat. Last week on the payphone, Pico and Alexander, she saw something she was scared of. Tug's car driving by, the Pin driving, but she wouldn't have seen the Pin. No, she was across the street, angel. She saw the passenger side. She saw you. She saw you and ran like she saw some devil.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And she took the hit. Dode hid her away, but the Pin was on to her, tracked her down, told her to meet him, that they would make good. Gave her a time, and a place. And sent Tug. Just to get the straight. But maybe you had talked Tug up, or maybe he just blew a fuse, but Em sprung it on him that she had her kid, and he did what anyone could count on Tug doing - he hit her. She took the hit for you. You let her take it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're going to tell me it's not?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know me. I've only helped you. How can you - It isn't true!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I hope it isn't. I want you to have been on my side all along, not just trying to get me under your thumb like Brad and the Pin and Tug.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's good. That means you didn't let me walk into a slaughterhouse. You didn't lead Tug and the Pin and their crews to the slaughter. And when Trueman reads the note, takes my cue and searches your locker, he won't find a damn thing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Trueman and several other men force Laura's locker open. From its dark interior the chalky white brick falls out, spins through the air, and shatters silently on the locker cage floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A moment of silence between them. The basketball nets jangle. Laura steps back. She looks as if she has been punched in the face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her face does strange things, subtle contortions. She watches his eyes. He doesn't look at her. Her voice shakes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Done. Well. That's most of it. 9 out of
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Slowly, steadily, she straightens up. Her figure takes back some dignity. She steps towards him deliberately. Closer. Right up against him. She brings her head to his, puts her lips to his ear, breathes warm breath, and says two words. The first is
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the second is low, guttural and lost to the whistling wind. She turns and walks briskly away. Brendan watches her go across the dark, barren field of asphalt. Metal jangles. Brendan turns to see the Brain hopping a chain link fence. Brendan turns his eyes back on Laura.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Brain starts to walk away, but turns back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brendan stands alone on the asphalt field, watching Laura until she reaches the end of the field and walks off behind a twisted chain linked fence. The first period bell rings, and Brendan walks back towards campus.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . I told Em to tell Tug it was his. Told her it would soften him up. She said she wished she could keep it, but she didn't love the father. I was going to drive her down the next day, we'd found a doctor. Most wouldn't. She was starting to show. 3 months. You know whose kid that makes it, or have you known all along?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, well. Chuck Burns came to. The knife guy. Spilled it all to the bulls, guess Brad Bramish hired him. On his own, just a grudge thing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (nods slightly) Fits. You did good, Brain. Go sleep.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She called me a dirty word.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Alright, you don't have to tell me. Thick.
dialogue.name: dialogue
